abstracts.cdata!:
The Buk Bijela Hydropower Project for
            Yugoslavia was appraised in 1974 at the request of the
            proposed Borrower. The Board approved the loan on June 5,
            1975 and loan documents were signed on June 30, 1975. During
            the course of various discussions aimed at achieving loan
            effectiveness, it became apparent that a dispute over water
            rights had developed between the Republic of Bosnia
            Herzegovina and the Republic of Montenegro. The project was
            to be implemented in Bosnia Herzegovina, and Montenegro was
            not willing to give its approval to ratification of the
            guarantee agreement. The Bank later learned that the
            inter-republic disputes arose from a proposal by Montenegro
            to divert the waters of the Tara river into the Adriatic Sea
            via the Moraca river for the purpose of another project. The
            project was canceled on February 29, 1976 after the Bank was
            informed by the Government that the unanimous agreement of
            all republics needed to pass the effective legislation would
            not be forthcoming.
